entries.title: UK Labour Would Expand Windfall Tax to Freeze Energy Price Cap
entries.description: The UK Labour Party said it would keep the freeze on household energy bills at £2,500 ($3,100) funded by a tougher windfall tax on oil and gas companies.

entries.title: US, Allies Agree to Move Toward Price Caps on Russian Fuels
entries.description: Oil pumping jacks, also known as "nodding donkeys", operate in an oilfield near Neftekamsk, in the Republic of Bashkortostan, Russia, on Thursday, Nov. 19, 2020. The flaring coronavirus outbreak will be a key issue for OPEC+ when it meets at the end of the month to decide on whether to delay a planned easing of cuts early next year. Photographer: Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg

entries.title: Russian Billionaire’s Yacht Helpers Charged in US Sanction Scheme
entries.description: Two businessmen were charged by US authorities with helping operate Russian billionaire Viktor Vekselberg’s yacht in violation of sanctions imposed four years ago.

entries.title: Juul Settlement to End Youth-Vaping Lawsuits Gets Initial Approval
entries.description: Juul Labs Inc. won preliminary approval of a settlement aimed at resolving thousands of lawsuits targeting the e-cigarette maker as a major cause of a US youth-vaping epidemic.

entries.title: Supreme Court Marshal Says She Questioned Justices Over Leak
entries.description: US Supreme Court Marshal Gail Curley said she questioned each of the nine justices while investigating the leak of a draft opinion overturning abortion rights and concluded she had no information implicating either them or their spouses.

entries.title: US Can Slow Inflation Without Unemployment Spike, Fed Study Says
entries.description: The US and other industrialized countries may be able to bring inflation down without triggering the huge jumps in unemployment that economists may have predicted prior to the pandemic, according to new research from the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago.

entries.title: Austin Warns US Allies Time Is Short Before Russian Offensive
entries.description: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin said time is running out to give Ukraine the advanced weapons it needs before an expected Russian offensive in the spring, as both the US and Germany hold out against Kyiv’s requests for their most powerful battle tanks.

entries.title: Treasury Has About $500 Billion Worth of Extraordinary Measures
entries.description: The Treasury Department has about $500 billion of extraordinary measures available that will allow the US to dodge a payments default as Congress works out an agreement on raising the debt limit, which the nation hit Thursday.

entries.title: Trump Demands Republicans Spare Entitlements in Debt Fight
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump directed his party not to cut Social Security or Medicare, which House Republicans have put on the table as part of any solution to the standoff over raising the US federal debt ceiling.

entries.title: GOP Attack on IRS Budget Undercuts Clean-Energy Credits, Treasury Says
entries.description: The U.S. Treasury Department building in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Saturday, June 26, 2021. The Federal Reserve might consider an interest-rate hike from near zero as soon as late 2022 as the labor market reaches full employment and inflation is at the central bank's goal.

entries.title: Biden Will Speak to McCarthy, Warns US Default Would Be ‘Calamity’
entries.description: President Joe Biden said he would discuss the debt limit with Republican House Speaker Kevin McCarthy and raise the issue in his State of the Union, saying it would be a financial “calamity” if the US defaults on its obligations.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins Named to Succeed Jacinda Ardern as New Zealand Prime Minister
entries.description: New Zealand’s ruling Labour Party said Chris Hipkins is the sole nominee to succeed outgoing leader Jacinda Ardern, all but confirming he will become the nation’s next prime minister.

entries.title: New Jersey Tells Bars It’s OK to Ban Guns During Bitter Giants-Eagles Game
entries.description: Bar owners in New Jersey — a National Football League battleground between fans of the Giants and the Eagles — are being encouraged to ban guns ahead of the teams’ Saturday division playoff.

entries.title: US Labels Russia’s Wagner Group a Criminal Organization in New Bid to Blunt Its Power
entries.description: The Biden administration designated Russia’s Wagner Group a transnational criminal organization in a new effort to blunt the mercenary company’s powerful role on the battlefield in Ukraine and around the world.

entries.title: Yellen Says Treasury System Not Built to Prioritize Certain Debt
entries.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the department doesn’t prioritize some bills over others, and that any non-payment of obligations is a default that would “undoubtedly” trigger a recession.

entries.title: Democratic Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia to Seek Reelection
entries.description: His retirement would have been a blow to Democrats politically and practically in a swing state that is prized by both parties.

entries.title: UK Police Fine Sunak for Failing to Wear Seat Belt
entries.description: MORECAMBE, ENGLAND - JANUARY 19: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visits Northern School of Art on January 19, 2023 in Hartlepool, United Kingdom. Rishi Sunak visits community projects in Lancashire and County Durham to announce a £2bn plus investment in over 100 projects across the UK through the levelling up fund. (Photo by Scott Heppel - Pool/Getty Images)

entries.title: Documentary on Brett Kavanaugh Sex-Assault Allegation Debuts at Sundance Today
entries.description: Justice, a documentary about the sexual assault allegations Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh faced before his confirmation, is set to debut at the Sundance Film Festival on Friday night.

entries.title: McConnell Debt Pledge May Sap McCarthy’s Push for Spending Cuts
entries.description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s push to use the threat of a catastrophic debt default to extract spending cuts from Democrats risks being undermined by his fellow Republican Mitch McConnell, who’s assuring that the US will never breach the limit.

entries.title: Hoosier City Takes on Debt in Bet on Kids Sports
entries.description: Mishawaka, Indiana, is serious about high-school athletics, no surprise in a state whose nickname inspired the movie Hoosiers, an archetype of small-town sports heroics.

entries.title: Germany Budgets €40 Billion for Next-Generation Fighter Jet
entries.description: The German government has earmarked about €40 billion ($43.2 billion) in spending by 2040 for its next-generation fighter jet, part of a European effort to upgrade the region’s defense capabilities.

entries.title: Youngkin Says Ford Has ‘Trojan Horse’ Relationship With Chinese Battery Maker
entries.description: Virginia Governor Glenn Youngkin is calling an electric-vehicle battery plant planned by Ford Motor Co. and a Chinese partner a “Trojan horse” for China that would undermine policy efforts to strengthen the US auto industry.

entries.title: Germany Allows Ukraine ‘Preparatory’ Training on Leopard Tanks
entries.description: Germany hasn’t made a decision to allow the sending of Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine, but will allow other countries to train Ukrainian soldiers on the vehicles.

entries.title: UK Closes In On £300 Million Climate Package for British Steel
entries.description: The UK government is close to agreeing a £300 million ($372 million) package to help British Steel cut its carbon emissions and prevent thousands of job losses.

entries.title: Rwanda Says Congo Hiring Mercenaries Heightens Risk of War
entries.description: Tensions on Democratic Republic of Congo’s eastern front with neighboring Rwanda led Congo to hire private military groups — a move Rwanda said is an indication of war.

entries.title: Germany Taps Former Goldman Banker as CFO of Nationalized Uniper
entries.description: A photo taken on July 22, 2022 shows the logo of energy supplier Uniper in the entrance hall at the company's headquarters in Dusseldorf, western Germany. - The German state will take 30% of the capital of the energy giant Uniper, threatened with bankruptcy by the declines in the delivery of Russian gas, as part of a vast rescue plan, the group announced on July 22, 2022. (Photo by Ina FASSBENDER / AFP) (Photo by INA FASSBENDER/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Chinese Battery Plant Investment Faces Local Backlash in Hungary
entries.description: Hungarian protesters disrupted an event in the city where Chinese battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. and Mercedes-Benz Group AG plan a 7.3 billion-euro ($7.9 billion) factory, signaling growing opposition to the country’s single biggest investment.

entries.title: DeSantis Wins Battle With Prosecutor Ousted for Abortion Stance
entries.description: A federal judge declined to reinstate Florida prosecutor Andrew Warren, after Governor Ron DeSantis suspended him because Warren said he wouldn’t bring criminal charges under the state’s 15-week abortion ban.

entries.title: Supreme Court Leak Report Leaves Critical Question: Were Justices Interviewed?
entries.description: The US Supreme Court’s inconclusive report on the source of last year’s leaked draft opinion showed the limits of its ability to investigate itself and doesn’t squarely address a critical question: Were the justices ever questioned?

entries.title: Trump Drops Florida Suit Against New York AG Over Fraud Case
entries.description: Donald Trump voluntarily dismissed the Florida lawsuit he filed against New York Attorney General Letitia James challenging parts of her $250 million fraud case against him and his business, a rare retreat by the former president in his long-running clash with her.

entries.title: Erdogan Warns Greece to Beware ‘Crazy Turks’ to Fire Up Crowd
entries.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan turned to nationalist rhetoric against Greece to fire up supporters ahead of this year’s elections, warning Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis not to antagonize him over long-running territorial disputes.

entries.title: GOP Quietly Plots What’s Next on Abortion in Nod to 2022 Failures
entries.description: Republicans still haven’t solved the quandary of how to talk to voters about abortion, still stinging from their midterm losses and with the White House at stake in less than two years.

entries.title: Dismissal of Activist From South Africa Nuclear Regulator Unlawful, Court Rules
entries.description: The dismissal of an anti-nuclear activist from the board of South Africa’s National Nuclear Regulator by the country’s energy minister was unlawful and unconstitutional, the country’s High Court ruled.

entries.title: Germany Says Tanks Would Go to Ukraine Quickly After Any Deal
entries.description: Germany’s new defense minister, Boris Pistorius, said his government hasn’t made a decision yet on supplying its Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine but that it could move quickly if an agreement can be reached with NATO allies.

entries.title: France Lifts Military Budget as Risk of High Intensity War Grows
entries.description: France will increase its defense budget over six years as President Emmanuel Macron seeks to adjust the nation’s military to new threats posed by the war in Ukraine and technological attacks.

entries.title: Russia Boosts Air Defenses Around Moscow Amid Drone-Strike Fears
entries.description: Russian authorities have deployed air-defense installations in and around Moscow after several drone attacks hit the country’s heartland.

entries.title: Yellen Blames Russia, China Over Actions She Says Hurt Africa
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen blamed Russia for worsening Africa’s economic problems and took a separate swipe at China over its lending practices, in an effort to contrast America’s actions with the behavior of its biggest rivals for influence on the continent.

entries.title: Erdogan Readies Debt Relief for Millions as Election Approaches
entries.description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is preparing to announce what could be his costliest pre-election giveaway yet with a plan to offer debt relief to millions of people.

entries.title: Tank Decision Tests Resolve of Kyiv’s Allies
entries.description: A meeting of Ukraine’s allies in Germany about delivering more powerful weapons to Kyiv shows just how much the geopolitical landscape has shifted in the past year.

entries.title: Sunak Urged to Cut UK Reliance on Taiwan Chips Due to China Risk
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s government should take steps to cut UK reliance on semiconductors from Taiwan because of the threat posed by China, a draft strategy said.

entries.title: German Defense Chief Says Tanks for Ukraine Not Linked to US
entries.description: Germany’s new defense minister, Boris Pistorius, signaled that the government in Berlin may change its position on supplying — or allowing allies to supply — Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: Meloni Heads to Algeria as Italy Seeks to Bolster Gas Security
entries.description: Giorgia Meloni will travel to Algeria this weekend, as Italy seeks more natural gas from the African country.

entries.title: Swiss Minister Signals Support Using Russian Assets for Ukraine
entries.description: Switzerland’s Foreign Minister Ignazio Cassis signalled his country’s support for the idea of confiscating frozen Russian assets and using them for the reconstruction of Ukraine, putting him on a collision course with the country’s banks who hate the proposal.

entries.title: Secret Police Probe Nigerian Central Bank Boss Amid Standoff
entries.description: Nigeria’s secret police are investigating central bank Governor Godwin Emefiele for alleged financial crimes related to the nation’s multibillion-dollar public lending programs, according to a court affidavit. The banker’s defenders say politicians opposed to recent currency reforms are behind the probe.

entries.title: The Coyotes Working the US Side of the Border Are Often Highly Vulnerable, Too
entries.description: When people cross the US-Mexico border hoping to immigrate, they encounter a smuggling network whose operators are often highly vulnerable themselves.

entries.title: More Ambulance Workers Join Mass Strike Day at UK Health Service
entries.description: Britain’s state-run health service is set for its worst ever day of industrial action after another union announced 10 more strike dates.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Defense Ministers Meet to Discuss Tanks for Kyiv
entries.description: The US and its allies meet in Ramstein, Germany, Friday, to discuss more military assistance for Ukraine, including heavy weapons, with pressure mounting on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to deliver Leopard tanks.

entries.title: China’s Covid-19 Fight, Protests in France: The Political Week in Photos
entries.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping called for greater efforts to   fight Covid-19 amid a soaring death toll, as many more Chinese travel back to their hometowns for the Lunar New Year festival.

entries.title: Germany Saw 180,000 Excess Deaths During Three Years of Covid
entries.description: Around 180,000 more people died in Germany during the three years of the Covid-19 pandemic than would have otherwise been expected, according to calculations published by the ifo Institute on Friday.

entries.title: Le Maire Says US Wants to Oppose China, EU Wants to Engage It
entries.description: Europe mustn’t get embroiled in a standoff between China and the US, and should instead forge its own path in strengthening economic relations, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said.

entries.title: Davos Latest: Le Maire Doesn’t See France Sliding Into Recession
entries.description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he expects his country’s economy will avoid a contraction this year, underscoring the messages of resilience from the global elite in Davos.

entries.title: South African Post Office to Cut Working Hours, Retrench Staff
entries.description: The South African Post Office plans to reduce its working hours and retrench employees in a bid to cut its wage bill, Chief Executive Officer Nomkhita Mona said.

entries.title: Ethiopian Prime Minister Appoints Mamo as Central Bank Governor
entries.description: Ethiopia’s prime minister appointed Mamo Mihretu as governor of the National Bank of Ethiopia.

entries.title: More People Going Home in China for Lunar New Year Than in 2022
entries.description: Many more Chinese people are traveling back to their hometowns for the Lunar New Year festival this year, with the end of Covid Zero and pandemic controls meaning people could once again move around freely inside China.

entries.title: Plans to Weaken Israel’s Judiciary Are Spooking Tech Investors
entries.description: Executives at unicorn startups and VCs are speaking out against elements of the new government’s agenda.

entries.title: Why Erdogan’s Reelection Bid in Turkey Isn’t a Sure Bet
entries.description: Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who wields almost unbridled power in Turkey, is seeking another term as president in elections likely to come in May. With the country facing an economic crisis, polls suggest a tight race that could threaten his 20-year rule, the longest in Turkey’s history. Even before a date’s been set, it’s become a rancorous contest. Electoral rules have been rewritten to give Erdogan and his party an edge. And critics say he’s leaning on the courts to disqualify strong competitors and

entries.title: German Tanks for Ukraine Are Stuck as the US Resists Sending Its Own
entries.description: The US and some European nations are struggling to overcome Germany’s reluctance to supply its Leopard battle tank to Ukraine, a disagreement that threatens to distract from the unity that allies want to project at a crucial defense ministers meeting later on Friday.

entries.title: Macron Faces Prolonged Battle Over Pensions as Unions Dig In
entries.description: The biggest protest of Emmanuel Macron’s time in office is setting the stage for a prolonged, legacy-defining battle over pension reform for the French president as neither he nor labor unions are leaving room for compromise.

entries.title: China and Australia Agree to Virtual Meeting for Trade Talks
entries.description: China and Australia’s top trade representatives will meet for virtual talks after months of speculation and delays, the latest sign of a potential breakthrough in the economic dispute between the two countries.

entries.title: Vietnam Succession Battle Heats Up After President’s Ouster
entries.description: Over the past few years, Vietnamese Communist Party Chief Nguyen Phu Trong has won praise from investors for removing corrupt officials. Now as some big names fall, it’s becoming clear his campaign serves another purpose: strengthening his hand in choosing a successor.

entries.title: Major Fire in Seoul’s Gangnam Neighborhood Destroys 60 Homes
entries.description: A blaze destroyed at least 60 homes in one of Seoul’s last remaining shantytowns on Friday, forcing the evacuation of about 500 people just before Lunar New Year, South Korea’s biggest holiday.

entries.title: Chicago Mayoral Candidates Slam Lightfoot on Her Safety Record
entries.description: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot faced a wave criticism on the city’s security record during the first televised mayoral debate on Thursday as candidates jockeyed to replace her at the top of the third-largest city in the US.

entries.title: Trump, Lawyer Hit With $1 Million Sanctions in Clinton Case
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump and one of his top lawyers were ordered by a judge to pay a total of almost $1 million in sanctions to Hillary Clinton, her 2016 campaign and more than a dozen political operatives who he accused of running a vast conspiracy to damage his reputation.

entries.title: Mask Mandate Lifted Everywhere But Public Transit in Korea
entries.description: South Korea will drop its mask mandate for most indoor venues, and Japan is considering changes to its recommendations, as some of the last Asian countries to require coverings pivots to living with Covid.

entries.title: CIA Director Burns Assures Ukraine of US Support in Kyiv Visit
entries.description: CIA Director William Burns traveled to Kyiv last week, where he sought to reassure Ukrainian leaders that the US would maintain support as the war drags on.

entries.title: Saudi Wealth Fund, PGA Hit “Impasse” Over Documents in LIV Suit
entries.description: The PGA Tour and Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund are deadlocked in a fight over information the tour wants from the fund and its governor for a trial in Saudi-backed LIV Golf’s antitrust suit against its North American rival.

entries.title: US Is Sending Ukraine Armored Vehicles in $2.5 Billion Package
entries.description: The Biden administration announced a major new package of military hardware for Ukraine, sending 90 Stryker armored personnel carriers, 59 Bradley fighting vehicles and an array of other gear as western allies look to give the country a boost before Russia launches a new ground campaign expected this spring.

entries.title: Hawaii Businesswoman Gets 2 Years for Trying to Stop 1MDB Probe
entries.description: A Hawaii businesswoman was sentenced to two years in prison for helping to illegally lobby the Trump administration to drop an investigation into the 1MDB global bribery scandal and remove a Chinese dissident from the US.

entries.title: These Are The Contenders to Replace New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern
entries.description: The race to become New Zealand’s next prime minister is wide open following Jacinda Ardern’s shock decision to resign and her obvious successor and deputy Grant Robertson confirming he will not be going for the job.
